meanings.definition: To surpass in crowing or boasting.
meanings.sent1: The rooster outcrowed all the other birds in the farmyard.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outcrow his friends by telling bigger stories.
meanings.sent3: The little bird outcrowed the big rooster in a playful singing contest.
meanings.sent4: She outcrowed her opponents with her confident speech during the debate.
meanings.sent5: The lion outcrowed the hyenas to establish dominance in the pride.

meanings.definition: To defeat or outdo in a competition or contest.
meanings.sent1: The team outcrowed their rivals in the final match of the tournament.
meanings.sent2: She managed to outcrow her classmates in the spelling bee competition.
meanings.sent3: The underdog outcrowed the reigning champion in a surprising turn of events.
meanings.sent4: The young athlete outcrowed the older competitors with her speed and agility.
meanings.sent5: The magician outcrowed his peers with his mind-blowing tricks at the talent show.
